This arrow deals {{Color|Anemo DMG}} based on the DMG of a fully charged Aimed Shot from "[[Parthian Shot|Normal Attack: Parthian Shot]]."<br><br>'''Pressurized Collapse'''<br>The Hurricane Arrow will apply a Pressurized Collapse effect to the opponent or character hit. This effect will be removed after a short delay, creating a vortex that deals {{Color|AoE Anemo DMG}} and pulls nearby objects and opponents in. If the Hurricane Arrow does not hit any opponent or character, it will create a Pressurized Collapse effect at its point of impact.<br>The vortex DMG is considered Elemental Skill DMG.
|CD            = 6s
|Duration      = 18s

|utility1      = Vacuum Field

{{Description|The winds of truth buffet the spirits of those who seek truth, dispersing the miasma of preconception.}}
'''Wind Realm of Nasamjnin''' is [[Faruzan]]'s [[Elemental Skill]].

==Gameplay Notes==
* {{Talent Note|particles|Pressurized Collapse|2}}
** This particle generation has a cooldown of '''5.5''' seconds.
* Pressurized Collapse Vortex DMG can hit ally objects such as [[Baron Bunny]], [[Guoba Attack|Guoba]], [[Yuegui]], etc. and trigger [[Swirl]] reactions if the hit object is affected by an element.

;<big>Passive Effects</big>
* {{Talent Note|character=Faruzan|talent=Wind Realm of Nasamjnin|ascension|1|Impetuous Flow}}

;<big>Constellation Effects</big>
* {{Talent Note|constellation|1|Truth by Any Means}}
* {{Talent Note|constellation|3|Spirit-Orchard Stroll}}
* {{Talent Note|constellation|4|Divine Comprehension}}

==Trivia==
===Etymology===
*{{Lang|''Nasamjnin''|zh=非想|zh_rm=Fēixiǎng|zh_tl=Nonperception}} is derived from the Buddhist term for the {{Lang|"sphere of neither perception nor non-perception"|sa=नैवसंज्ञानासंज्ञायतन|sa_rm=Naivasaṃjñā'''nāsaṃjñ'''āyatana|zh={{wt|非想非非想處|非想非非想天}}|zh_rm=Fēixiǎng Fēifēixiǎng Tiān|sort=sa,zh}}, the highest of the four spheres in the {{w|Buddhist cosmology#Formless Realm (Ārūpyadhātu)|Formless Realm (Ārūpyadhātu)}}. In Buddhist beliefs, "nonperception" means that those who reach this sphere do not engage in "perception" at all, although within the context of the Talent's description, "nonperception" refers to dispelling preconceived notions.
